results.name: Variation (3) on Recamán's sequence (A005132): set s (the step size) initially equal to 2; to get a(n), we first try to subtract s from a(n-1): a(n) = a(n-1)-s if positive and not already in the sequence, in which case we change s to s+1; if not, a(n) = a(n-1)+s+i, where i >= 0 is the smallest number such that a(n-1)+s+i has not already appeared and now we change s to s+i+1
comment: Variation (4) (A064389) is the nicest of these variations.
I would also like to get the following sequences: number of steps before n appears (or 0 if n never appears), list of numbers that never appear, height of n (cf. A064288, A064289, A064290), etc.
